column1: Causes may include: - A type of anemia in which red blood cells in the blood are destroyed earlier than normal (hemolytic anemia) - Anemia due to low iron - After certain infections, major surgery or trauma, or allergic reactions - Cancer - Certain medicines - Bone marrow disease called polycythemia vera - Bone marrow making too many platelets without a known cause (primary thrombocythemia) - Recent spleen removal Some people with high platelet counts may be at risk of forming blood clots.
